channel.title: Bypass school internet "restricted area's"
channel.description:
[ul]This is simple to do, and great for if your in some boring class with a computer near by. You can go to ANY website you want doing this, so far i have not found a site where the school will block it ;).
[b]Creating A Comand Prompt.[/b] [list] [li]Computers at school don't give you a comand prompt, so we will have to make one. Do this by opening up notepad, type in "command.com".[/li] [li]File>Save As. Change the Save Type As : to ALL FILES![/li] [li]Name it whatever you want, but make it a *.bat. Example : CP.bat[/li] [/list]
[b]Getting The Ip[/b] [list] [li]Now open up your new command prompt.[/li] [li]Type in the words "ping", hit the spacebar, and type in the URL of the website you want to go to. Example : ping www.runescape.com[/li] [li]Wait a second, then a bunch of things will pop up, look for the Ip, it will be enclosed somewhere at the top by some of these[ ].
[/list]
[list] [li]Now type the Ip into the address bar on in your internet explorer, and now you can go to that site which would normaly be restricted, whatever that site may be ;)[/li] [/list]
[url=http://img330.imageshack.us/my.php?image=s7yq.swf&width=800]Watch It Here![/url] ^^ Here's a lil video that i put together for all you visual learner's :D[/ul]
[b]Ron: [/b] Editted out TUT in title. It's the tutorial section, it's implied.

item.title: Bypass school internet "restricted area's"
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:114, topic:3443”][quote author=vortex link=topic=4092.msg3214080#msg3214080 date=1274549250]
Here is a better tutorial:

  1. Buy a cheap VPS (eg https://www.serverffs.com/vps/) with your classmates
  2. Install and configure tinyproxy
  3. Set your browser to use the proxy you just set up

That’s how we get past the panda gaydefender
[/quote]
or just l2tunnel[/quote]… derp

Read full topic

item.title: Bypass school internet "restricted area's"
item.dc:creator: @_X12 ~X~
item.description:
@_X12 wrote:

[quote=“Omfgurweird, post:16, topic:3443”][quote author=zoss0 link=topic=4092.msg40715#msg40715 date=1148990493]
Sounds good, but our school has a monitoring and it sends alarms to the admins who’s watching you then they kick the crap out of you…
[/quote]
lol well, i know another trick that i will make a tut for later but heres what it is. Basicly, you can make yourself, and admin, or another account an admin, or demote an admin, or even delete their account completely! I have done this, i made my account an admin at school, but know this! If you do anything stupid you WILL GET CAUGHT, and dont try to hold me responsible, because i warned ya ;p[/quote]

^ LOL, someone knows how to use net localgroup administrators yourusername /add

That works perfectly, except for the fact that you need administrator rights to do it.

Otherwise, you get system error 5 access denied.

net localgroup administrators username /add or /remove depending on what you want your action to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Bypass school internet "restricted area's"
item.dc:creator: @reece844 reece844
item.description:
@reece844 wrote:

[quote=“nicatron, post:99, topic:3443”][quote author=poor noob link=topic=4092.msg946796#msg946796 date=1172556599]
at my school i do this *might not work for your school

1)first at the login screen type your user name and pass
2)next go to the back of the computer and find the network cable
3)then hit enter and when u see the screen change and it says “loading your personal settings”
4)now quickly unplug the network cable and wait till the desktop has loaded and plug it back in.
Now the computer has nothing blocked and it takes off anything that restricted you before.
The only downside is that you cant load stuff from your personal drive on the schools network.
**if you unplug the network cable to early it wont let you log in, and if you unplug it to late then it wont work. you should unplug it withen 1 - 2 secs after you hit enter.

Try this id like to know if it works for any of you guys.[br][size=1]Posted on: February 26, 2007, 07:02:46 PM[/size][hr]Oh yeah i was also told that if you load fire fox on a usb drive you can auctally plug it in and run fire fox off your usb drive, i never tried it but i heard it works.
[/quote]

portable firefox @ www.portableapps.com
Edit: direct download link ::::

http://sourceforge.net/project/downloading.php?groupname=portablefirefox&filename=Firefox_Portable_2.0.0.6_en-us.paf.exe&use_mirror=easynews[/quote]
smart wouldn’t have thought of that…

Read full topic

item.title: Bypass school internet "restricted area's"
item.dc:creator: @reece844 reece844
item.description:
@reece844 wrote:

bustinthejus:

lmao my school blocks uncatagorized ip adresses…

Wow that has got to suck i don’t know a way out of that.

—^^^^Getting into your computer’s C Drive^^^—

Ok first get into Taskbar and Start Menu(It should be under Control Panel or under your Start menu)

At the top there should be two tabs, click on Start Menu. Note:you need to be on classic start mode.

Then at the bottom right click Customize… and a new window should appear.

Finally there should be 5 buttons and a check bosx at the bottom. Click the Advanced Button.

Ok now you are in your c drive. You can acess Cookies (To delete them) Program Files, Documents and Settings too. You are in!

Read full topic
